blogs.Title: JavaScript latest Version in 2021.
blogs.Descriptionshort: ECMAScript is the official name of the language. ECMAScript
blogs.Descriptionfull: versions have been abbreviated to ES1, ES2, ES3, ES5, and ES6. Since 2016 new versions are named by year (ECMAScript 2016 / 2017 / 2018).

blogs.Title: Most asking question is what is current Bootsrap version ?
blogs.Descriptionshort: Bootstrap 5 stable was released on May 5, 2021.
blogs.Descriptionfull: Bootstrap  5 beta 3 was released on March 22, 2021. Bootstrap 5 beta 2 was released on February 10, 2021. Bootstrap 5 beta 1 was released on December 7, 2020.

blogs.Title: Most asking question in interview which is current PHP version ?
blogs.Descriptionshort: Currently, the latest stable version is PHP 7.4.

blogs.Title: What is Sass ?
blogs.Descriptionshort: Sass is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted
blogs.Descriptionfull: or compiled into Cascading Style Sheets. SassScript is the scripting language itself. Sass consists of two syntaxes. The original syntax, called 'the indented syntax,' uses a syntax similar to Haml.

blogs.Title: defer in javascript.
blogs.Descriptionshort: The defer is a Boolean value, used to indicate that script is executed after
blogs.Descriptionfull: the document has been parsed. It works only with external scripts (i.e., works only when we are specifying the src attribute in

blogs.Title: jQuery Version 3.6.0 Released!
blogs.Descriptionshort: jQuery 3.6.0 has been released. jQuery is a lightweight, write less
blogs.Descriptionfull: , do more,JavaScript library.jQuery takes a lot of common tasks that require many lines of JavaScript code to accomplish,and wraps them into methods that you can call with a single line of code.

blogs.Title: What is meant by event bubbling ?
blogs.Descriptionshort: Event bubbling is a type of event propagation where the event first triggers
blogs.Descriptionfull: on the innermost target element, and then successively triggers on the ancestors (parents) of the target element in the same nesting hierarchy till it reaches the outermost DOM element or document object (Provided the handler is initialized).
